alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Butler; Perry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 2:34PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Light Freezing Rain Possible Monday... Daily rain chances return to the forecast starting Monday. As the rain approaches from the west, temperatures may still be below freezing when it makes its onset across portions of southeast Missouri and southern Illinois. The highest likelihood for any ice accretion is across the Missouri Ozark Foothills where the precipitation arrives the earliest. However, a light glaze of ice is possible for areas along and west of a Dexter, Missouri to Fairfield, Illinois line. Temperatures go above freezing during the afternoon and evening, transitioning the precipitation to all rain. Plan for the potential for slippery roads from light icing on your Monday morning commute, particularly in the southeast Missouri Ozarks and near vicinity. The NWS will continue to monitor this system closely and update or heighten the awareness of this potential hazard should conditions warrant.
